medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden weakness of both legs for 2 days, with marked swelling and pain in the right leg.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began suddenly 2 days prior to admission, characterized by weakness, swelling, and pain in the right leg. After treatment with intravenous urokinase, subcutaneous low molecular weight heparin for 7 days, and subsequent oral rivaroxaban, muscle myodynamia of lower limbs returned to grade 5 without edema after 50 days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous history of old cerebral infarction for 6 years and old myocardial infarction for 4 years. No history of hypertension or diabetes mellitus.
medical_history.family_history: Patient's father died of a slow heart rate at 36 years old. Elder sister and younger brother diagnosed with Atrial Standstill (AS) and have pacemakers implanted.
